newsitem.title: UK: Emerging market debt well bid amid positive tone.
newsitem.headline: Emerging market debt well bid amid positive tone.

text.p: The emerging debt market was well bid across the board on Tuesday, dealers said.
Russia and Bulgaria were especially firm amid good news and Latin American bonds were up, they said.
"We see a better tone in U.S. Treasuries, ongoing investor demand and the fundamentals continue strong," a dealer said.
Another dealer said: "The whole market has been well bid generally."
News that Bulgaria will peg the national lev currency to the mark as anchor in a currency board system to be launched July 1, at a fixed exchange rate of 1,000, was lifting debt, dealers said.
"Investors have taken this as good news," a dealer said.
Bulgaria FLRB were up 0.375 point at 52.75 bid. Bulgaria IAB were up 0.375 point at 68.625 bid and Bulgaria DISC were up 0.375 at 69.375.
Russian VN US$ were 0.5 point up at 87.50 bid amid expectations of further positive news between Russia and the London Club following meetings in Frankfurt today.
Meanwhile in Latin America, dealers said they were awaiting further details on Brazil's swap deal.
Overnight in New York, Brazil set a minimum yield of 9.946 percent for its $1.0 billion global bond issue, via joint lead managers Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan.
Brazil's debt swap allows investors to tender their par bonds, discount bond or C bond for the 30-year global bond issue or to purchase outright the new issue.
The invitation is scheduled to expire at 1500 EDT/1900 GMT on Tuesday.
Brazil IDUS were bid at 98.50, Brazil "C" were bid at 79.625 and Brazil PAR were bid at 66.50.
